Description:
Please Contact Us to Book a Private Inspection
This wonderfully presented brick veneer home on 548sqm (approx.) boasts quality finishes and spacious living throughout. Situated in a sought after pocket of Marshall, it's the perfect family home, ideally suiting first home buyers, investors and downsizers. Featuring a spacious and light filled open plan living, bi-folds doors open to an undercover decked area which is fantastic for entertaining and family barbeques, the functional kitchen is complete with stone benchtops, walk-in pantry, gas cooking and dishwasher, the rumpus room provides a secondary living space, sizable home office, main bedroom with walk-in robe and ensuite with double vanity, a further two bedrooms both with built-in robes share a family bathroom and the double garage includes handy internal access. Outside the home is surrounded by neatly landscaped gardens with plenty of yard for the kids to play. Extra comforts include central heating and evaporative cooling throughout. Conveniently located close to the Marshall train station, schools, local shops and easy access to the Bellarine Peninsula and Geelong CBD. This stunning home must be inspected to be appreciated!
Insights: 40 MacFarlane Street, Marshall VIC 3216 was last sold in 2020 and 28 other 3 bedroom house in Marshall have recently been sold.

Description:
A Grand Family Home on 1219sqm
Please call Josh directly on 0452 501 353 to arrange a private inspection.
Firmly planted on a tremendous 1219sqm (approx.) allotment showcasing meticulously groomed gardens, this exciting property offers the space and tranquillity of rural living along with the convenience of central suburbia.
Custom built to allow for the growing family, the residence though traditional in presentation provides all the space the modern family desires. A testament to this property's versatility stems from the abundance of accommodation excelled by multiple zones that're sure to satisfy all of your entertaining requirements. Imagine relaxing poolside with the family on a warm summer's day or even rugged up in front of the open fire with a good read, the list of positives is endless.
This grand property is one not to be missed and will undoubtedly offer year's of enjoyment to those seeking all the comforts of the perfect family home!
Further features include:
- 3x car garage + carport for secure boat, caravan or trailer storage
- Ducted heating, cooling and vacuum
- 2 fireplaces (1x gas log and 1x open)
- In ground pool serviced by outdoor bathroom/pool house
- Moments from Nazareth, Mandama and Grovedale West Primary School's & Grovedale College, Waurn Ponds Shopping Centre, Leisurelink, Deakin University and Geelong Ring Road access.
Internal area
1219m²
Insights: 2 Vermeer Court, Grovedale VIC 3216 was last sold in 2020 and 77 other 4 bedroom house in Grovedale have recently been sold.

Description:
Perfect Low Maintenance Living!
Perfectly positioned to suit down-sizers, investors and first homeowners alike, this two-bedroom townhouse offers the lucky purchaser to be in amongst the ultimate location for convenience. Nestled just a short stroll from public transport, local shops, schools and easy access to the Surf Coast, as well as the Geelong CBD.
Offering immaculate presentation, an easy low maintenance lifestyle and its own separate title with no body corporate or common ground.
This fantastic floor plan consists of a large open plan living, dining and kitchen which offers stone bench tops, dishwasher and a 900mm free standing oven. The two large bedrooms both contain built in robes and are serviced by a modern central bathroom with separate toilet.
Completing the floorplan is the full laundry with external access leading through to the private yard area, made whole with the undercover alfresco a great space for the weekend entertainer.
Many extras in the home include gas central heating, split system air conditioning, 9ft ceilings throughout, high grade timber flooring, 2000L water tank and an oversized single remote garage with internal and rear access.
Grovedale is quickly becoming recognized as one of the most convenient suburbs the Geelong region has to offer, and this property rings true to that statement offering the ever-growing Waurn Ponds Shopping Complex, Deakin University, Epworth Hospital, Leisurelink all a hop skip and jump away!
Any inspection will undoubtedly impress. Dont be the person that misses out on this rare opportunity.
Insights: 1/25 Heyers Road, Grovedale VIC 3216 was last sold in 2020 and 32 other 2 bedroom unit in Grovedale have recently been sold.

Description:
Modern! Spacious! This is the ONE!
A relaxed, easy-going atmosphere is evident from the moment you step inside this stylish home. Situated on 512 m2, this property has plenty of backyard, side access and beautiful finishes. Comprises of tiled entry, master bedroom, which is complete with ceiling fan, his/hers walk in robe, ensuite with large shower, vanity and toilet. There are a further two bedrooms, both with built in robes serviced by the family bathroom. The focal point of this home is the generous open plan living space, with carpeted living area, tiled kitchen/meals area and double sliding doors opening out onto the covered outdoor alfresco area. The contemporary Kitchen is fully equipped with great storage and is complete with quality stainless steel appliances including dishwasher, cupboard space and stone bench tops. The property has gas heating, a split system reverse air-conditioner and a solar hot-water system. The double garage has an automatic door, rear roller door and side access which is ideal for trailers, additional parking, or caravan/boat storage. The gardens to the front are well established, with plenty of backyard for the kids to play in, and a planted garden bed running the full width of the property. Whether this is your first home, downsizer or that perfect investment, with easy access to the Marshall train station, shopping village, ring road and the Surf Coast, you will find this a very affordable and attractive opportunity!
Contact Pete Norman 0424 167 567 or Miranda Williams 0402 938 655 for further information.
*All information about the property has been provided to Hayeswinckle by third parties. Hayeswinckle has not verified the information and does not warrant its accuracy or completeness. Parties should make and rely on their own enquiries in relation to this property.

Description:
Modern & centrally located home in a quiet setting
Youll love:
The peace & quiet this home provides being set back from the road while still being centrally located.
The well laid-out floorplan boasting of 2 living areas for you to spread out, with a combined kitchen, dining & living area upstairs that provides ocean views.
2 spacious bedrooms with large built in robes & a master bedroom with a walk-in-robe.
Plus:
Enjoy entertaining on your second story balcony that flows out from the main living area.
Other features include timber floors, reverse cycle heating/cooling & a European laundry.
Double remote-controlled garage with internal & drive-through access to a private rear backyard.
Conveniently located only minutes from Whites Beach, Loch Ard Drive convenience store and easy access to public transport.

Description:
Downsizers, Investors, First Home Buyers - Look No Further!
Here is a golden opportunity to purchase an extremely well kept three bedroom home on its own block/title. Bigger than your average unit and with no body corporate to worry about makes this property definitely a "pick above the rest".
Central to the home is the gorgeous light filled open plan living, kitchen and dining area. The island bench in the kitchen is a stand out feature that will make food preparation a breeze. Plenty of cupboard space, a large cavity for fridge and freezer, dishwasher and pantry further distinguish the kitchen. A split system in the nearby living area takes care of temperature requirements as well as ceiling fans in the bedrooms. The master bedroom at the front is accompanied by a spacious walk through robe to the main bathroom. The toilet and laundry are both spacious and high ceilings throughout the property ensure you're not "boxed in."
Step outside to the picturesque north facing courtyard. Some low maintenance greenery and rose bushes define the area as a lovely tranquil space - perfect for the morning cuppa! A garden shed in this area is also a nice extra feature.
With Waurn Ponds Shopping Centre only minutes away all shopping needs are more or less at your doorstep. Access to the Ring Road and Epworth Hospital are also nearby. A little further drive and you're into the Geelong CBD - all in all ensuring this property will be a sound investment for years to come.
Insights: 32 Shiraz Drive, Waurn Ponds VIC 3216 was last sold in 2020 and 19 other 3 bedroom house in Waurn Ponds have recently been sold.

Description:
Quality and Class in Outstanding Location
Set in a premier location, this outstanding residence has been designed and built to exacting standards with magnificent views across Geelong and surrounds.
Showcasing the highest quality in every way, this exceptional family home complete with all furnishings is positioned within easy distance to shopping centers, Queens Park, Geelong's CBD, and some of Geelong's finest schools.
Designed to enhance a family lifestyle, offering multiple living zones including fully equipped theatre room, also incorporating a versatile indoor/outdoor living space all set on approx. 1321m2.
Internally the home exudes quality and cutting-edge design.
Ideally located, the master features private study nook, walk in robe and stunning en-suite with double vanity, freestanding bath and stone finishes.
Three further large bedrooms, all with robes, one with WIR, spacious family bathroom also with freestanding bath, double vanity and stone finishes.
This home features a stunning kitchen with Bosch S/S appliances including (3 ovens and built in coffee machine), dishwasher, stone benches and full butler's pantry with double sink.
The laundry is faultless with custom cabinetry and plenty of storage complete with Bosch washing machine and dryer.
There are many special additions, some of which include fully ducted zoned reverse cycle air-conditioning/heating throughout, double glazed windows, excellent garaging with direct access and landscaped gardens. Rent approx. $750 furnished.
This exemplary family home really has it all.
*All information about the property has been provided to Hayeswinckle by third parties. Hayeswinckle has not verified the information and does not warrant its accuracy or completeness. Parties should make and rely on their own enquiries in relation to this property.

Description:
Character property, views across Queens Park.
IMPORTANT NOTICE REGARDING COVID-19:
Open for inspections will no longer be scheduled for the public. To organise your own private viewing, please contact Cam on 0406 597 050.
Please check our Head Office guidelines below before meeting with one of our agents or before viewing a property by appointment.
Visit: https://barryplant-production.s3.amazonaws.com/media/documents/COVID-19_Barry_Plant_Information.pdf for more information.
Enjoy walks around the Barwon River or Buckley Falls, or play a round of golf at Queens Park Municipal Golf Course. This substantial four bedroom home is situated on approximately 636sqm in a much coveted pocket in the Queens Park Estate, and is filled with architectural angles, soaring timber lined ceilings and exposed brick, adding timeless character to the home. Delightful lounge/sitting room extends to an expansive north facing terrace and formal dining leads to kitchen/family area overlooking the secluded rear garden and outdoor entertaining area.
Master bedroom featuring walk in robe and ensuite, three other generous bedrooms serviced by the central bathroom, teenager's retreat/rumpus room, separate laundry and storage room/wine cellar complete the overall layout of the home.
A sweeping driveway to garage and service area provides parking for additional cars, boat or caravan. Easy access to the Ring Road getting commuters to Melbourne in under an hour and just across the Barwon River to Geelong's finest schools and boutique shopping further underpins the desirability of this lifestyle property.
Insights: 13 Queens Park Road, Highton VIC 3216 was last sold in 2020 and 108 other 4 bedroom house in Highton have recently been sold.

Description:
Please Contact Us to Book a Private Inspection
You will be waking up to magnificent views of Geelong, Barwon River and the You Yangs while living in this impressive 4 bedroom family home. The prime location has convenient access to a variety of shopping centres, schools, Barwon River walking track and handy access to the ring road. Features include spacious open plan living with front balcony, main bedroom with views, ensuite and walk in robe, central kitchen with stone bench tops, 4th bedroom or rumpus room downstairs. Massive 4 car garage plus established garden. This is a wonderful opportunity to further improve and then enjoy all the benefits of living in this blue chip area of Highton.

Description:
Private Inspections Available
Spacious Living, Ample Vehicle Storage & A Superb Location!
Set upon approx. 660m2, this property will astound with spacious living zones, a north-facing backyard, and side vehicle access for caravans and boats!
With the Gateway Plaza and other local amenities only a short stroll from your front door, a blissful lifestyle is yours to keep. Whether youre picking up some groceries, enjoying a touch of retail therapy, or meeting a friend for lunch, the Gateway Plaza will leave you wanting nothing. The local sporting grounds and Bellarine Rail Trail will inspire the whole family to keep active, while the Leopold Primary School and Leopold Community Centre put the practical elements in place for families. Public transport is an instant away, while a short drive will find you in the vibrant heart of Geelong or the Bellarine Peninsula.
An abundance of natural light sweeps through the open plan living/dining/kitchen zone, which opens onto the sheltered alfresco deck for seamless open-air living. Whether youre enjoying a lazy weekend at home or youre entertaining family and friends, this space will effortlessly accommodate. The kitchen takes care of all your cooking needs with a walk-in pantry and stainless steel appliances (dishwasher, gas cooktop, canopy rangehood, Bosch oven). Pendant lights highlight the island bench, which doubles as a breakfast bar. The lounge offers immense versatility as a kids play space or even a large study.
Zoned to the rear of the home, the Master Bedroom is awash in northern light. The walk-in robe features built-in shelving, while the en suite is graced with a shower, single vanity and toilet. Two additional bedrooms with built-in robes, main bathroom, separate toilet, and laundry with external access complete the functional layout. Modcons include ducted heating, a split-system air conditioner, ceiling fans, and video intercom.
The backyard creates a wealth of space for children and pets alike. The playground will steal the hearts of little ones, while the veggie/herb gardens and fruit trees invite you to enjoy fresh produce straight from the source. Two garden sheds provide ample storage. The remote double lock-up garage features internal access, while the entire west side of the property offers room for storing caravans, trailers, or boats. Tradies will also see the appeal in constructing a work shed (STCA).
With every element in place for a superb family lifestyle, youll need to act swiftly to avoid disappointment! Inspect without delay!
Insights: 26 Benita Place, Leopold VIC 3224 was last sold in 2020 and 101 other 3 bedroom house in Leopold have recently been sold.

Description:
Sun, Sea and Sand
Private Inspections Welcome - By Appointment Only
With the ocean almost in your back garden and spectacular views, it cannot get any better than this. Park Lane is a premium address and properties here are rarely available. This is an exciting opportunity to be one of the lucky few to enjoy such a sought after spot. The low maintenance, two-storey townhouse offers effortless beachside living, which is perfect for permanent or holiday home home buyers as well as investors.
Enjoy the expansive ocean outlook from the kitchen and meals area, and the adjoining living zone, which is spacious and light filled. Or take it all in while watching the sunrise with an early morning coffee on the deck. There are three bedrooms in total, one on the upper level and two downstairs. A bathroom, powder room, laundry and lock up garage complete the floor plan. A compact courtyard offers private outdoor living and the grounds are easy care.
Torquay continues to be a well-loved holiday hot spot. This property will allow you to be in amongst the action in no time, or to settle in, relax and wind down while letting it all pass by. Walk to Bells Street boutique dining and shopping precinct in minutes. Or choose from family friendly Cosy Corner Beach, or grab the board and enjoy the surf without a wasting a precious moment.
The stunning ocean vista across the foreshore reserve cannot be built out and is guaranteed to be yours forever. Live the dream, right here, right now.
Insights: 2/2 Park Lane, Torquay VIC 3228 was last sold in 2020 and 126 other 3 bedroom house in Torquay have recently been sold.

Description:
Classic Old Torquay Style
Private Inspections - By Appointment Only
This quintessential Old Torquay beach house is full of potential and is located in an idyllic spot. Embrace its simplicity and enjoy just as it is or let the creative juices flow, harness the possibilities on offer here and elevate this property to the next level.
The existing weatherboard home retains much of its charm and1970s features, including solid timber flooring as well as floor to ceiling glazing that floods the living zone with natural light. The floor plan includes an original kitchen with meals area; a spacious living and dining; three bedrooms with built in robes; a bathroom and laundry. The log fire keeps things cosy in winter and a sunny deck will be appreciated all year round.
The 597m² (approx) allotment features established gardens, with shady spots to enjoy, that is fully fenced and private. A rainwater storage tank is also included.
Located in a quiet court, this home is just a few metres to the nearby walking tracks of Deep Creek Reserve leading to tennis courts, playground and Fishos Beach. Shops, schools and cafes are close by too, making this a convenient and sought after location.
Reconfigure, renovate or remove (STCA), or love it just the way it is, whatever you choose this location will always be in demand and ideal for easy Surf Coast living.
Insights: 77 Grandview Road, Torquay VIC 3228 was last sold in 2020 and 126 other 3 bedroom house in Torquay have recently been sold.

Description:
Modern Living at it's Best
Inspections by appointment only.
From the moment you walk through this grand entrance you will be taken in by this immaculate home. Built just over 10 years ago by Quantum Homes, it provides everything you expect in luxury family living.
Located conveniently to Waurn Ponds Station, 5 minutes to the Waurn Ponds Shopping and Home Maker Centres, only 7 minutes to Deakin University and Epworth Hospital, and just under 15 minutes to your favourite Surf Coast beaches.
Showcasing expansive living with a low maintenance garden and set on approximately 699m2 this 4 Bedroom home comprises;
Master bedroom retreat, with his and hers walk in robes and spacious ensuite and spa
3 generous bedrooms, 2 with walk in robes and the 3rd with large built in robe
Expansive central kitchen overlooking an open-plan dining and living space
Separate lounge/cinema room and 2nd Leisure area
Fully furnished built in study
Ducted heating and refrigerated cooling throughout
Garaging for two vehicles with internal access and separate large garden shed
Undercover alfresco entertaining area
At Wilsons we are conscious of playing our part in reducing the spread of COVID-19. We will therefore be conducting our property inspections strictly on a 'one on one' basis and by using best practice sanitary measures to ensure everyone's safety. We can also arrange a virtual tour of the home if that better suits. Contact us today.

Description:
Must Sell / Best Value In Belmont
Set on 355m2 and perfectly positioned in prime Blue Chip Belmont, this brick veneer home is ready for a new owner to make their own. A blank canvas for the astute first home buyer, investor, renovator, developer or downsizer alike. Conveniently located within walking distance to High St Shops, Highton Village Café Precinct and only moments to the Geelong CBD & Stunning Waterfront, Waurn Ponds Shopping Centre, Epworth Hospital and the M1 taking you to Melbourne in under an hour.
Boasting charm and street appeal, this solid home is comprised of three spacious bedrooms sharing a central and updated bathroom, large lounge with split system for heating and cooling, second toilet, a well-proportioned second living area and a laundry completing the internal accommodation.
This is an exceptional opportunity in today's marketplace and must be sold at Auction on April 4th. 10% deposit with a 30/60/90 day settlement is required. Currently tenanted at $300 per week until October 2020.

Description:
Wonderful potential in the heart of Belmont
A once in a lifetime opportunity awaits to bring this original Circa 1950s home back to life. It has been in the family for three generations and is now ready for a new owner to take the keys and enjoy the lifestyle Belmont has to offer. Only a short walk to Belmont's shopping precinct, this 3 bedroom brick home sits in a very convenient and central location. Positioned near public transport, schools, cafes, shopping facilities and is only minutes to the stunning Geelong Waterfront, Geelong CBD and the Geelong Ring Road taking you to Melbourne in less than an hour.
If you have been waiting for a chance to purchase in one of Geelong's most fast growing suburbs, now is the time!
• North facing 690m2 allotment
• 3 bedrooms
• Large living room with split system
• Spacious kitchen with original wood oven and a walk in pantry
• Large backyard with garden shed
• Double gate access to garage
• Ample off street parking
Renovate, extend or just move straight in, this property at 68 Mt Pleasant Road Belmont is a rare find! Don't miss out, inspect today.
*All information about the property has been provided to Hayeswinckle by third parties. Hayeswinckle has not verified the information and does not warrant its accuracy or completeness. Parties should make and rely on their own enquiries in relation to this property.

Description:
Fully renovated, elite position.
Sale by Set Date® : Wednesday 8th April at 5pm.
$620,000 - $650,000
IMPORTANT NOTICE REGARDING COVID-19:
Open for inspections will no longer be scheduled for the public. To organise your own private viewing, please contact Cam on 0406 597 050.
Please check our Head Office guidelines below before meeting with one of our agents or before viewing a property by appointment.
Visit: https://barryplant-production.s3.amazonaws.com/media/documents/COVID-19_Barry_Plant_Information.pdf for more information.
Positioned in highly sort after pocket, here we have a gorgeously renovated property, perfect for the first home buyer or investor. Embrace the locale of being just moments away from the ever so popular Highton Village, where you'll find inviting cafés, restaurants and boutique retail stores, not to mention walking distance to quality schooling in Montpellier Primary and Highton Primary School. This impressive weatherboard home consists of four bedrooms with, master including its own walk through robe, ensuite, split system and seamless access onto the rear deck. Remainder of bedrooms are serviced by the shared central bathroom and separate toilet.
Spacious kitchen and plenty of cupboard space overlooks dining area and backyard, where you can supervise the little ones when they're on the deck or playing on the lawn. The large frontal sundrenched lounge includes a gas heater and air conditioning split system. In addition, beautifully polished hardwood flooring lies throughout the entire property and flourishes in the natural light.
Outside is sure to impress with plenty of lawn for kids and pets to run around, along with a single car garage, you'll have no issue enjoying your new north/easterly backyard.
This property home is sure to attract array of buyers including first home buyers, families after the school zoning or a savvy investor look to take advantage of the recent rate cuts and capitalising on a solid investment.
Sale by SET DATE® is a method of selling a property where all interested buyers submit, in writing, their best and final offer. The date and time advertised is the absolute final deadline for all offers. Buyers can submit an offer at any time.
For further clarification on the process of Sale by SET DATE®, please contact Kieron directly on 0435 798 405
Insights: 11 Marcus Street, Highton VIC 3216 was last sold in 2020 and 108 other 4 bedroom house in Highton have recently been sold.

Description:
Downsize Into The Dream!
Exceptional opportunity in one of Grovedale's most convenient locations, this immaculately presented 2 BR unit is the perfect option for downsizers. Offering a quiet and private lifestyle with backyard space to either attend to the garden or utilize the side access for caravans or boats. The open plan design will impress with an inviting living room and light filled kitchen with quality appliances and plenty of bench/cupboard space. The two generous bedrooms both feature large built in robes & carpeted floors. The central bathroom offers shower, bath & vanity along with a separate toilet. Outside is very private & low maintenance with plenty of room to entertain. Additional features such as gas wall heater, split system and secure lock up garage this stunning unit is a must see!
Within walking distance to Waurn Ponds Shopping Centre, public transport, local schools and sporting fields, and only a few moments' drive to Deakin University, Epworth Hospital, Marshall train station and Geelong ring road. Get in quick opportunities like this don't last!
*All information about the property has been provided to Hayeswinckle by third parties. Hayeswinckle has not verified the information and does not warrant its accuracy or completeness. Parties should make and rely on their own enquiries in relation to this property.
